elements.title: Claus Guth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Claus Guth (pictured), recognised internationally for directing the 1999 premiere of Berio's Cronaca del luogo at the Salzburg Festival, later received two Faust awards?

elements.title: Refugee Paralympic Team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the world's 82 million refugees will be represented at the 2020 Summer Paralympics by the Refugee Paralympic Team?

elements.title: Mairin Mitchell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Orwell said of Mairin Mitchell's Storm over Spain (1937) that it was "written by a Catholic, but very sympathetic to the Spanish Anarchists"?

elements.title: tamper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the W71 nuclear warhead had a tamper made of gold?

elements.title: Elias Camp Morris (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Theodore Roosevelt sent National Baptist Convention president Elias Camp Morris to investigate atrocities committed in the Congo Free State?

elements.title: Brachystelma tumakurense (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brachystelma tumakurense's stem is so weak that it sometimes bends under the weight of leaves and flowers?

elements.title: Tonic Immobility (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tonic Immobility's "pure, undiluted chaos" is "an escape from the realities of the world"?

elements.title: sentenced to death by Francis Drake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Thomas Doughty was sentenced to death by Francis Drake, the two men dined and received communion together just before Doughty's execution?
